required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Organization of Teratology Information Services (OTIS) Autoimmune Diseases in Pregnancy Project
clinical_study.official_title: OTIS Autoimmune Diseases in Pregnancy Project

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effect of etanercept when used in the first trimester of pregnancy with respect to major structural birth defects of newborns. This is an observational study only - no investigational product is used.

detailed_description.textblock:
This pregnancy registry cohort study will be conducted by the Organization of Teratology Information Specialists (OTIS) which is a network of university and health department based telephone information centers serving pregnant women and health care providers throughout North America.
Participants in the first two cohorts are recruited concurrently from callers to OTIS centers, from health care providers and through direct to consumer marketing efforts. The source of historical controls is archived data on pregnancies that have been followed through the California Teratogen Information Service's Clinical Research Program located at the University of California San Diego.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With Major Birth Defects in Pregnancies Ending With Live-born Infants
primary_outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
primary_outcome.description: A major structural defect is defined as a defect which has either cosmetic or functional significance to the child (e.g., a cleft lip). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With Major Birth Defects in All Pregnancies
primary_outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
primary_outcome.description: A major structural defect is defined as a defect which has either cosmetic or functional significance to the child (e.g., a cleft lip). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With Any 3 or More Minor Birth Defects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
secondary_outcome.description: A minor structural defect is defined as a defect which occurs in less than 4 percent of the population but which has neither cosmetic nor functional significance to the child (e.g., complete 2,3 syndactyly of the toes). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With a Specific Pattern of Any 3 or More Minor Birth Defects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
secondary_outcome.description: A minor structural defect is defined as a defect which occurs in less than 4 percent of the population but which has neither cosmetic nor functional significance to the child (e.g., complete 2,3 syndactyly of the toes). A pattern is defined as at least the same 3 specific minor malformations occurring in at least two infants in the exposed group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Pregnancies Ending in Spontaneous Abortion
secondary_outcome.description: Computed using Kaplan-Meier estimate at 20 weeks gestation, accounting for left truncation due to varying time in gestation at enrollment. In multiple pregnancies ending in at least 1 live-born infant, the live birth outcome is included in the analysis. In multiples ending in no live birth outcomes, the spontaneous abortion is counted as 1 event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pre-term Delivery
secondary_outcome.description: A pretem delivery is defined as prior to 37 weeks gestation. Computed using Kaplan-Meier estimate at 37 weeks' gestation, accounting for left truncation due to varying time in gestation at enrollment. Multiple births are excluded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gestational Age at Delivery (GAD) of Live Births
Birth Weight Among Full Term Infants
Birth Length Among Full Term Infants
Birth Head Circumference Among Full Term Infants
Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Length
secondary_outcome.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Head Circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.

secondary_outcome.measure: Postnatal Weight Percentile at One Year
Postnatal Length Percentile at One Year
Postnatal Head Circumference Percentile at One Year
Percentage of Infants at One Year of Age With Small for Gestational Age Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Postnatal growth deficiency defined as ≤ 10th centile for chronological age. Age adjusted for gestational age at delivery if child was less than 12 months of age at postnatal measurement, unadjusted if ≥ 12 months of age at postnatal measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants at One Year of Age With Small for Gestational Age Length
secondary_outcome.description: Postnatal growth deficiency defined as ≤ 10th centile for chronological age. Age adjusted for gestational age at delivery if child was less than 12 months of age at postnatal measurement, unadjusted if ≥ 12 months of age at postnatal measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants at One Year of Age With Small for Gestational Age Head Circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Postnatal growth deficiency defined as ≤ 10th centile for chronological age. Age adjusted for gestational age at delivery if child was less than 12 months of age at postnatal measurement, unadjusted if ≥ 12 months of age at postnatal measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Infants With Reported Serious or Opportunistic Infections Through One Year
Percentage of Infants Diagnosed With Any Malignancy Through One Year of Age
Percentage of Infants With Abnormal Results on Ages and Stages Questionnaire (ASQ)
secondary_outcome.description: The ASQ-3 evaluates 5 domains of development: communication, gross motor, fine motor, problem solving, and personal-social. Each domain has a set of 6 items and parents rate the most appropriate answer for the presence of each skill: "Yes," "Sometimes," "Not Yet," with point values of 10, 5, or 0, respectively. Each domain question set is totaled independently and compared against statistically derived cutoffs that are set at 2 standard deviations below the mean. The percentage of infants below the cut-off or close to the cutoff (borderline) is reported.

arm_group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.
Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

Pregnant women not diagnosed with RA, JRA, AS, PsoA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any TNF antagonist at any time in pregnancy and were not exposed to any known human teratogen during pregnancy. This cohort consists of historical controls enrolled in other pregnancy outcome studies selected to match pregnant women in the exposed cohort.

intervention.description: Pregnant women previously exposed to etanercept during the first trimester. Etanercept was not administered in this non-interventional study.

biospec_descr.textblock: This is a prospective & observational, exposure cohort study

study_pop.textblock: Cohort 1: Exposure Cohort (300 subjects) Cohort 2: Matched diseased control Cohort (300 subjects) Cohort 3: Non-diseased Control Cohort (300 subjects)

criteria.textblock:
Cohort 1 Inclusion Criteria: Eligible subjects will be currently pregnant women residing in the US or Canada who have had any exposure to etanercept for treatment of Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA), Juvenile RA, Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS), Psoriatic Arthritis (PsoA) or Psoriasis (PsO) at any time during the first trimester of pregnancy which is defined as the period between first day of the last menstrual period (i.e., within two weeks of conception) up to and including the 12th week after the first day of the last menstrual period (LMP) - Eligible subjects must have documentation of an exposure to etanercept during the first trimester of pregnancy.
Cohort 2 Inclusion Criteria: Eligible subjects will be currently pregnant women residing in the US or Canada who have not taken etanercept or any TNF antagonist for treatment of RA, JRA, AS, PsoA or PsO at any time in the current pregnancy or within two months prior to the first day of the last menstrual period (LMP).
Cohort 3 Inclusion Criteria: Eligible subjects will be pregnant women who were residing in the US or Canada who had not been diagnosed with RA, JRA, AS, PsoA or PsO and had not been exposed to a known human teratogen during the index pregnancy.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited concurrently from callers to Organization of Teratology Information Specialists (OTIS) centers, from health care providers and through direct to consumer marketing efforts. A third cohort of historical controls including 296 women was also included in the study but are not included in the results of this report.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The first participant was recruited in April, 2005 and recruitment continued through March 19, 2012.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

Indicates participants with a known outcome of pregnancy

group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: Maternal Age at Estimated Due Date

measure.title: Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Maternal Education
Hollingshead Socioeconomic Category
measure.description: Based on four-factor Hollingshead categories incorporating maternal and paternal education and occupation; highest socioeconomic status category = 1; lowest socioeconomic status category = 5.

measure.title: Pre-pregnancy Height
Pre-pregnancy Body Weight
Gravidity Category
Parity Category
Previous Spontaneous Abortion
Previous Elective Terminations
Previous Preterm Delivery
Any Previous Child with Birth Defect
In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) with This Pregnancy
Gestational Age at Time of Enrollment
Referral Source Category
Geographic Area of Residence
Maternal Comorbidities
measure.description: Participants could have more than one comorbidity

class.title: Antidepressant Medication Use in Any Trimester

measure.title: Prenatal Multivitamin or Folic Acid Supplements
Alcohol Use During Pregnancy
Tobacco Use During Pregnancy
Major Known or Suspected Human Teratogens
Intended Pregnancy
Primary Disease (RA, JRA, PsA or AS)
Duration of Disease
measure.description: Year was known, but month and date were not known for all cases, therefore Jan 1 of the year of diagnosis through the 1st day of the last menstrual period for the index pregnancy was used to calculate duration of disease. In cases where the woman had multiple study diseases, the earliest known year of the “primary disease” diagnosis was used to calculate duration. Five participants in the Etanercept-Exposed Group were missing year of diagnosis.

measure.title: Prednisone and/or Systemic Oral Corticosteroid
Disease Severity Score - RA
measure.description: RA1 disease severity score expressed as the Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) summary score; possible score ranges from 0-3 with higher score representing higher severity/disability. RA1 disease severity score at intake missing for 2 participants in the Etanercept-Exposed Group and 1 participant in the Diseased Controls Group.

measure.title: Disease Severity Score - PsO
measure.description: Maternal rating of overall severity of psoriasis measured using Global Assessment of Psoriasis, possible score 0-5 with higher score indicating more severe disease.

measure.title: Exposed to Etanercept
measure.description: the first trimester of pregnancy is defined as the period between the estimated date of conception (DOC) to the 11th week post-conception. The date of conception is defined as 14 days prior to the next expected menstrual period.

class.title: Last Menstrual Period to Date of Conception
Started Prior to DOC, End Date Unavailable

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With Major Birth Defects in Pregnancies Ending With Live-born Infants
outcome.description: A major structural defect is defined as a defect which has either cosmetic or functional significance to the child (e.g., a cleft lip). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.
outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
outcome.population: Includes multiple pregnancies ending in at least 1 live-born infant; any 1 or more malformed live-born infants counted as 1 major malformation outcome in the numerator, and 1 pregnancy outcome in the denominator. Only women exposed to etanercept in the 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Major Birth Defects in Pregnancies Ending With Live-born Infants
measure.description: A major structural defect is defined as a defect which has either cosmetic or functional significance to the child (e.g., a cleft lip). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.
measure.population: Includes multiple pregnancies ending in at least 1 live-born infant; any 1 or more malformed live-born infants counted as 1 major malformation outcome in the numerator, and 1 pregnancy outcome in the denominator. Only women exposed to etanercept in the 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

analysis.estimate_desc: Adjusted oddds ratio for major structural defects in women exposed to etanercept in their 1st trimester versus not exposed computed using logistic regression adjusted for propensity score comprised of asthma and maternal height

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With Major Birth Defects in All Pregnancies
outcome.description: A major structural defect is defined as a defect which has either cosmetic or functional significance to the child (e.g., a cleft lip). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.
outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
outcome.population: Includes multiple pregnancies counted as 1 outcome; any 1 or more malformed infant counted as 1 major malformation in the numerator and 1 outcome in the denominator. Excludes 9 lost-to-follow-up in Etanercept-Exposed and 6 in Diseased Controls cohort. Only women exposed to etanercept in 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Major Birth Defects in All Pregnancies
measure.description: A major structural defect is defined as a defect which has either cosmetic or functional significance to the child (e.g., a cleft lip). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.
measure.population: Includes multiple pregnancies counted as 1 outcome; any 1 or more malformed infant counted as 1 major malformation in the numerator and 1 outcome in the denominator. Excludes 9 lost-to-follow-up in Etanercept-Exposed and 6 in Diseased Controls cohort. Only women exposed to etanercept in 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

analysis.estimate_desc: Adjusted oddds ratio for major structural defects in women exposed to etanercept in their 1st trimester versus not exposed computed using logistic regression adjusted for propensity score comprised of asthma and maternal height

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With Any 3 or More Minor Birth Defects
outcome.description: A minor structural defect is defined as a defect which occurs in less than 4 percent of the population but which has neither cosmetic nor functional significance to the child (e.g., complete 2,3 syndactyly of the toes). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.
outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
outcome.population: Children born to enrolled participants during the study who received the dysmorphological exam. Includes singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from twin pairs. Only women exposed to etanercept in the 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Any 3 or More Minor Birth Defects
measure.description: A minor structural defect is defined as a defect which occurs in less than 4 percent of the population but which has neither cosmetic nor functional significance to the child (e.g., complete 2,3 syndactyly of the toes). The Registry used the Metropolitan Atlanta Congenital Defects Program (MACDP) birth defect classification system, with some specified modifications that are appropriate for cohort studies as opposed to case-control studies.
measure.population: Children born to enrolled participants during the study who received the dysmorphological exam. Includes singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from twin pairs. Only women exposed to etanercept in the 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

analysis.estimate_desc: Unadjusted Odds Ratio computed using logistic regression. No adjusted estimate was computed due to no confirmed confounder.

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With a Specific Pattern of Any 3 or More Minor Birth Defects
outcome.description: A minor structural defect is defined as a defect which occurs in less than 4 percent of the population but which has neither cosmetic nor functional significance to the child (e.g., complete 2,3 syndactyly of the toes). A pattern is defined as at least the same 3 specific minor malformations occurring in at least two infants in the exposed group.
outcome.time_frame: From birth through 1 year of age
outcome.population: Children born to enrolled participants who received the dysmorphological exam. Includes multiples who received the exam for consideration of pattern; co-twins with the same 3 or more minor defects could not constitute a pattern on their own. Only women exposed to etanercept in the 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With a Specific Pattern of Any 3 or More Minor Birth Defects
measure.description: A minor structural defect is defined as a defect which occurs in less than 4 percent of the population but which has neither cosmetic nor functional significance to the child (e.g., complete 2,3 syndactyly of the toes). A pattern is defined as at least the same 3 specific minor malformations occurring in at least two infants in the exposed group.
measure.population: Children born to enrolled participants who received the dysmorphological exam. Includes multiples who received the exam for consideration of pattern; co-twins with the same 3 or more minor defects could not constitute a pattern on their own. Only women exposed to etanercept in the 1st trimester are included in the Etanercept-Exposed cohort.

outcome.title: Percentage of Pregnancies Ending in Spontaneous Abortion
outcome.description: Computed using Kaplan-Meier estimate at 20 weeks gestation, accounting for left truncation due to varying time in gestation at enrollment. In multiple pregnancies ending in at least 1 live-born infant, the live birth outcome is included in the analysis. In multiples ending in no live birth outcomes, the spontaneous abortion is counted as 1 event.
outcome.population: Participants enrolled and exposed to etanercept prior to 20 weeks gestation (Etanercept-Exposed) or enrolled prior to 20 weeks gestation (Diseased Controls).

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Pregnancies Ending in Spontaneous Abortion
measure.description: Computed using Kaplan-Meier estimate at 20 weeks gestation, accounting for left truncation due to varying time in gestation at enrollment. In multiple pregnancies ending in at least 1 live-born infant, the live birth outcome is included in the analysis. In multiples ending in no live birth outcomes, the spontaneous abortion is counted as 1 event.
measure.population: Participants enrolled and exposed to etanercept prior to 20 weeks gestation (Etanercept-Exposed) or enrolled prior to 20 weeks gestation (Diseased Controls).

analysis.estimate_desc: Adjusted HR computed using Cox proportional hazards regression adjusted for propensity score comprised of referral source (3 categories: OTIS, Pharmaceutical Company/Sponsor/HCP, Patient Support Group/Internet/Other), and maternal height.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-term Delivery
outcome.description: A pretem delivery is defined as prior to 37 weeks gestation. Computed using Kaplan-Meier estimate at 37 weeks’ gestation, accounting for left truncation due to varying time in gestation at enrollment. Multiple births are excluded.
outcome.population: Participants enrolled and exposed to etanercept prior to 37 weeks gestation (Etanercept-Exposed) or enrolled prior to 37 weeks gestation (Diseased Controls), and excluding multiple births.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-term Delivery
measure.description: A pretem delivery is defined as prior to 37 weeks gestation. Computed using Kaplan-Meier estimate at 37 weeks’ gestation, accounting for left truncation due to varying time in gestation at enrollment. Multiple births are excluded.
measure.population: Participants enrolled and exposed to etanercept prior to 37 weeks gestation (Etanercept-Exposed) or enrolled prior to 37 weeks gestation (Diseased Controls), and excluding multiple births.

analysis.estimate_desc: Adjusted HR computed using Cox proportional hazards regression adjusted for preeclampsia

outcome.title: Gestational Age at Delivery (GAD) of Live Births
outcome.population: Live births in women enrolled and exposed to etanercept prior to 37 weeks’ gestation (Etanercept-Exposed) or enrolled prior to 37 weeks gestation (Diseased Controls), excluding multiple births.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Gestational Age at Delivery (GAD) of Live Births
measure.population: Live births in women enrolled and exposed to etanercept prior to 37 weeks’ gestation (Etanercept-Exposed) or enrolled prior to 37 weeks gestation (Diseased Controls), excluding multiple births.

analysis.estimate_desc: Computed using linear regression, directly adjusted for referral source (not collapsed), vitamin use (not collapsed), preeclampsia, and asthma because propensity score adjustment was not balanced.

outcome.title: Birth Weight Among Full Term Infants
outcome.population: Live birth full-term infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Birth Weight Among Full Term Infants
measure.population: Live birth full-term infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available

analysis.estimate_desc: Computed using linear regression, directly adjusted for asthma, RA2 severity score at 32 weeks, and disease severity score imputation indicator because propensity score adjustment was not balanced.

outcome.title: Birth Length Among Full Term Infants
outcome.population: Live birth full-term infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Birth Length Among Full Term Infants
measure.population: Live birth full-term infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available

analysis.estimate_desc: Computed using linear regression, adjusted for propensity score comprised of preeclampsia and asthma.

outcome.title: Birth Head Circumference Among Full Term Infants
outcome.population: Live birth full-term infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Birth Head Circumference Among Full Term Infants
measure.population: Live birth full-term infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available

analysis.estimate_desc: Computed using linear regression, adjusted for maternal age (categorical).

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Weight
outcome.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.
outcome.population: Live-born infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Weight
measure.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.
measure.population: Live-born infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available.

analysis.estimate_desc: Computed using logistic regression, adjusted for propensity score comprised of maternal height, referral source (OTIS, Sponsor/HCP, Patient Support Group/Internet/Other), PsO disease severity score at 32 weeks, & disease severity imputation indicator

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Length
outcome.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.
outcome.population: Live-born infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Small for Gestational Age Birth Length
measure.description: Small for gestational age is defined as ≤ 10th percentile for sex and gestational age using National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) / Center for Disease Control (CDC) growth curves.
measure.population: Live-born infants, excluding multiple births, where data were available.

analysis.estimate_desc: Unadjusted Odds Ratio computed using logistic regression. An adjusted estimate was not computed due to the small number of events.

outcome.population: Live-born infants, including singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from multiple pregnancies, born to enrolled women exposed to etanercept at any time during pregnancy (Etanercept-Exposed).

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Reported Serious or Opportunistic Infections Through One Year
measure.population: Live-born infants, including singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from multiple pregnancies, born to enrolled women exposed to etanercept at any time during pregnancy (Etanercept-Exposed).

outcome.population: Live-born infants, including singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from multiple pregnancies, born to enrolled women exposed to etanercept at any time during pregnancy (Etanercept-Exposed).

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants Diagnosed With Any Malignancy Through One Year of Age
measure.population: Live-born infants, including singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from multiple pregnancies, born to enrolled women exposed to etanercept at any time during pregnancy (Etanercept-Exposed).

outcome.title: Percentage of Infants With Abnormal Results on Ages and Stages Questionnaire (ASQ)
outcome.description: The ASQ-3 evaluates 5 domains of development: communication, gross motor, fine motor, problem solving, and personal-social. Each domain has a set of 6 items and parents rate the most appropriate answer for the presence of each skill: "Yes,” “Sometimes,” “Not Yet,” with point values of 10, 5, or 0, respectively. Each domain question set is totaled independently and compared against statistically derived cutoffs that are set at 2 standard deviations below the mean. The percentage of infants below the cut-off or close to the cutoff (borderline) is reported.
outcome.population: Live-born infants, including singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from multiple pregnancies, where data were available.

group.title: Etanercept-Exposed
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.title: Diseased Controls
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

measure.title: Percentage of Infants With Abnormal Results on Ages and Stages Questionnaire (ASQ)
measure.description: The ASQ-3 evaluates 5 domains of development: communication, gross motor, fine motor, problem solving, and personal-social. Each domain has a set of 6 items and parents rate the most appropriate answer for the presence of each skill: "Yes,” “Sometimes,” “Not Yet,” with point values of 10, 5, or 0, respectively. Each domain question set is totaled independently and compared against statistically derived cutoffs that are set at 2 standard deviations below the mean. The percentage of infants below the cut-off or close to the cutoff (borderline) is reported.
measure.population: Live-born infants, including singletons and 1 randomly selected twin from multiple pregnancies, where data were available.

analysis.estimate_desc: Unadjusted Odds Ratio computed using logistic regression. An adjusted estimate was not computed due to no confirmed confounder.

reported_events.time_frame: Mothers (enrolled women) were assessed during pregnancy (up to 9 months) and up to 6 weeks after delivery; Infants were assessed for up to 1 year after birth.
reported_events.desc: Only Serious Adverse Events were collected for this study.

group.title: Mothers Diseased Control
group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

group.description: Pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

group.description: Infants born to pregnant women with a current diagnosis of RA, JRA, AS, PsA, or PsO who did not use etanercept or any tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonist during pregnancy.

group.title: Infants Etanercept Exposed
group.description: Infants born to pregnant women with a current diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA), ankylosing spondylitis (AS), psoriatic arthritis (PsoA) or psoriasis (PsO) who used etanercept in the first trimester of pregnancy for any length of time.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
